leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 科研评测-基准/指标/复现实验生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 任务→指标→自动评测→leaderboard→回归

queries: [WEB] machine learning experiment tracking tools github

tools.name: Arline Benchmarks
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking platform for quantum circuit mapping and compression algorithms
tools.detailed_description: A platform designed to benchmark various quantum circuit mapping and compression algorithms against each other on a list of predefined hardware types and target circuit classes, facilitating evaluation in quantum computing research.

tools.name: rd-cdm
tools.one_line_profile: Ontology-based rare disease common data model
tools.detailed_description: A repository for the ontology-based rare disease common data model (RD-CDM) that harmonizes international registries, FHIR, and Phenopackets to support rare disease research and data interoperability.

tools.name: CTF for Science Framework
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking framework for dynamic system modeling methods
tools.detailed_description: A modular and extensible platform designed for benchmarking modeling methods on dynamic systems. It supports the evaluation and comparison of models for systems like ordinary differential equations (ODEs) and partial differential equations (PDEs) using standardized datasets and metrics.

tools.name: EvalAI
tools.one_line_profile: Open source platform for evaluating and comparing AI algorithms
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform for hosting AI challenges and evaluating state-of-the-art AI algorithms. It provides a standardized environment for benchmarking models across various tasks, including scientific datasets and competitions.

tools.name: DagsHub Client
tools.one_line_profile: Client libraries for DagsHub scientific collaboration platform
tools.detailed_description: Python client for DagsHub that facilitates scientific experiment tracking, data versioning, and collaboration. It integrates with MLflow and DVC to provide a unified interface for managing research projects.

tools.name: Fast Data Science (fds)
tools.one_line_profile: CLI for version controlling data and code in scientific projects
tools.detailed_description: A command-line tool that wraps Git and DVC (Data Version Control) to streamline the versioning of code and large datasets in data science and scientific research workflows.

tools.name: OpenVectorFormat
tools.one_line_profile: Data format for scanner-based laser-processing jobs
tools.detailed_description: A library and data format description for storing scanner-based laser-processing jobs, including vector-geometry data, processing parameters, and metadata, used in manufacturing science and material processing.

tools.name: GeoMet Data Registry
tools.one_line_profile: Registry system for managing and serving meteorological data via OGC standards
tools.detailed_description: A system to manage access to Environment and Climate Change Canada's Meteorological Service of Canada (MSC) open data, including raw numerical weather prediction (NWP) model data layers and weather radar mosaics, via Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC) standards.

tools.name: Otter
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-modal model based on OpenFlamingo for instruction following
tools.detailed_description: A multi-modal model based on OpenFlamingo, trained on MIMIC-IT, showcasing improved instruction-following and in-context learning ability for visual-language tasks.

tools.name: precisionFDA
tools.one_line_profile: Cloud-based platform for benchmarking NGS analysis pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A cloud-based platform that provides an environment where the community can test, pilot, and benchmark new approaches to validating their next-generation sequencing (NGS) analysis pipelines.

tools.name: SUPIR
tools.one_line_profile: Model for photo-realistic image restoration
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model aiming at developing practical algorithms for photo-realistic image restoration in the wild.

tools.name: FastTrackML
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance experiment tracking server compatible with MLflow
tools.detailed_description: An experiment tracking server focused on speed and scalability, designed to be compatible with the MLflow client for tracking machine learning experiments.

tools.name: kedro-mlflow
tools.one_line_profile: Kedro plugin for MLflow integration
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the Kedro framework that integrates MLflow capabilities, enabling machine learning model versioning, packaging, and experiment tracking within Kedro projects.

tools.name: Graph Learning Indexer (GLI)
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking platform for graph learning
tools.detailed_description: A contributor-friendly and metadata-rich platform for graph learning benchmarks, facilitating dataloading, benchmarking, and tagging of graph datasets and models.

tools.name: DVC (Deep Video Compression)
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end deep video compression framework
tools.detailed_description: An end-to-end deep learning framework for video compression, providing a model implementation for efficient video coding.

tools.name: LH-VLN
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark and platform for Long-Horizon Vision-Language Navigation
tools.detailed_description: A platform and benchmark suite for Long-Horizon Vision-Language Navigation (LH-VLN), designed to evaluate agents in complex navigation tasks.

tools.name: Snowman
tools.one_line_profile: Data matching benchmark platform
tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking platform designed for evaluating and comparing data matching (entity resolution) algorithms.

tools.name: Fast-AgingGAN
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning model for face aging
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model designed to simulate aging effects on face images, running efficiently on GPUs.

tools.name: Fast-SRGAN
tools.one_line_profile: Fast Super Resolution GAN for video upsampling
tools.detailed_description: A fast deep learning model (SRGAN) to upsample low-resolution videos to high resolution, optimized for speed.

tools.name: CMF (Common Metadata Framework)
tools.one_line_profile: Library for tracking metadata and lineage in ML pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A library to collect, store, and query metadata associated with ML pipelines, tracking lineage for artifacts and executions in distributed AI workflows.

tools.name: FakeSV
tools.one_line_profile: Multimodal benchmark for fake news detection
tools.detailed_description: A multimodal benchmark dataset and platform with rich social context for fake news detection on short video platforms.

tools.name: Sacred
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment configuration and tracking tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool to help configure, organize, log, and reproduce computational experiments, widely used in machine learning research.

tools.name: INCF EEG Database
tools.one_line_profile: Portal for managing and sharing EEG/ERP data
tools.detailed_description: A portal enabling researchers to store, update, download, and search data and metadata from EEG/ERP experiments.

tools.name: Incense
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive data retrieval for Sacred experiments
tools.detailed_description: A library to interactively retrieve and analyze data from experiments logged with the Sacred tool, facilitating experiment visualization and comparison.

tools.name: MLJModels.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Model registry for the MLJ framework in Julia
tools.detailed_description: The model registry and tools for model queries and code loading for the MLJ (Machine Learning in Julia) framework.

tools.name: Snowboy
tools.one_line_profile: DNN-based hotword detection library
tools.detailed_description: A customizable hotword detection engine based on deep neural networks, widely used in robotics and AI applications for audio processing.

tools.name: METR Eval Analysis
tools.one_line_profile: DVC pipeline for analyzing AI model evaluation data
tools.detailed_description: A public repository containing METR's data version control (DVC) pipeline designed for the analysis of evaluation data, facilitating reproducible research in model evaluation.

tools.name: MLReef
tools.one_line_profile: Collaboration workspace for Machine Learning experiment tracking
tools.detailed_description: A collaboration platform for machine learning that provides experiment tracking, model management, and reproducibility features to streamline the ML lifecycle.

tools.name: OpenCaptchaWorld
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for evaluating MLLM agents via CAPTCHA puzzles
tools.detailed_description: A web-based benchmark and platform designed to evaluate the visual reasoning and interaction capabilities of Multimodal LLM agents through diverse CAPTCHA puzzles.

tools.name: MetaBox
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking platform for Meta-Black-Box Optimization
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmarking platform designed for evaluating Meta-Black-Box Optimization algorithms, facilitating comparison and analysis of optimization strategies.

tools.name: PipelineX
tools.one_line_profile: ML pipeline builder integrating Kedro and MLflow
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that simplifies building machine learning pipelines for experimentation by integrating frameworks like Kedro and MLflow, focusing on developer efficiency.

tools.name: MiroFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source deep research agent for reproducible benchmarks
tools.detailed_description: A fully open-source deep research agent framework designed to achieve reproducible state-of-the-art performance on various AI benchmarks like GAIA and FutureX.

tools.name: CoolGraph
tools.one_line_profile: Library for simplifying Graph Neural Networks (GNN) usage
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning library designed to make Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) easier to implement and use for scientific and industrial graph learning tasks.

tools.name: ModelChimp
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment tracking for deep learning projects
tools.detailed_description: An experiment tracking tool tailored for machine and deep learning projects, allowing researchers to log, visualize, and compare model experiments.

tools.name: NVIDIA DeepLearningExamples
tools.one_line_profile: State-of-the-art deep learning scripts for reproduction and benchmarking
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive collection of state-of-the-art deep learning model implementations optimized for NVIDIA GPUs, serving as a primary resource for performance benchmarking and experimental reproduction.

tools.name: DANCE
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning library and benchmark for single-cell analysis
tools.detailed_description: DANCE is a deep learning library and benchmark platform specifically designed for single-cell analysis in computational biology, providing tools for clustering, imputation, and integration.

tools.name: What-If Tool
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive interface for probing and analyzing ML models
tools.detailed_description: A visual interface designed to help researchers and practitioners analyze machine learning models, understand their behavior, and assess fairness and performance across different data slices.

tools.name: Open-Sora-Plan
tools.one_line_profile: Open source reproduction of Sora text-to-video model
tools.detailed_description: An open-source project aiming to reproduce the Sora text-to-video model, providing training scripts, model architectures, and inference tools for the research community.

tools.name: mousetrap-os
tools.one_line_profile: Mouse-tracking plugin for OpenSesame psychological experiments
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the OpenSesame experiment builder that enables mouse-tracking data collection for psychological and behavioral research.

tools.name: PLIP
tools.one_line_profile: Pathology Language and Image Pre-Training foundation model
tools.detailed_description: A vision and language foundation model for pathology AI, fine-tuned from CLIP to extract visual and language features from pathology images and text descriptions.

tools.name: ProteoBench
tools.one_line_profile: Community-curated benchmarks for proteomics data analysis
tools.detailed_description: An open and collaborative platform for continuous, easy, and controlled comparison of proteomics data analysis workflows and pipelines.

tools.name: topsacred
tools.one_line_profile: Viewer and toolset for Sacred experiment databases
tools.detailed_description: A collection of functions and tools to interact with and visualize data stored by Sacred, a tool for configuring and organizing computational experiments.

tools.name: rocHPCG
tools.one_line_profile: HPCG benchmark for ROCm platform
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of the High Performance Conjugate Gradients (HPCG) benchmark, designed to measure performance of HPC systems, optimized for the ROCm platform.

tools.name: RagView
tools.one_line_profile: Unified evaluation platform for RAG methods
tools.detailed_description: A platform to benchmark different Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) methods on specific datasets, facilitating comparative analysis of AI models.

tools.name: RapidFire AI
tools.one_line_profile: Toolchain for rapid AI model customization
tools.detailed_description: A framework facilitating rapid AI customization ranging from Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) to Fine-Tuning, supporting AI research workflows.

tools.name: RoboVerse
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark and platform for robot learning
tools.detailed_description: A unified platform, dataset, and benchmark designed for scalable and generalizable robot learning research, enabling simulation and evaluation of robotic agents.

tools.name: SREGym
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark platform for SRE AI agents
tools.detailed_description: An AI-native platform for benchmarking Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) agents, evaluating their performance in managing software reliability tasks.

tools.name: QA-Board
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment tracker and visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: An experiment tracker to organize, visualize, compare, and share algorithm runs, designed to remove toil from R&D and performance tuning.

tools.name: SpeechIO Leaderboard
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking platform for Automatic Speech Recognition
tools.detailed_description: A robust and comprehensive benchmarking platform for evaluating Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR) systems.

tools.name: tensorboard-aggregator
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to aggregate TensorBoard runs
tools.detailed_description: A utility to aggregate multiple TensorBoard runs into new summary or CSV files, facilitating the analysis of multiple experiments.

tools.name: BEHAVIOR-1K
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark platform for Embodied AI
tools.detailed_description: A platform for accelerating Embodied AI research, providing a benchmark for evaluating agents on human-centric activities in simulation.

tools.name: RaySAR
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) simulator
tools.detailed_description: A 3D synthetic aperture radar (SAR) simulator that generates SAR image layers from detailed 3D object models, enabling localization and signal analysis.

tools.name: FHIRFLARE-IG-Toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for managing FHIR Implementation Guides
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive web app for managing FHIR Implementation Guides (IGs), including import, validation, processing, and conversion features for medical informatics.

tools.name: SwanLab
tools.one_line_profile: AI training tracking and visualization tool
tools.detailed_description: An open-source AI training tracking and visualization tool that integrates with popular frameworks like PyTorch and Transformers to monitor experiments.

tools.name: FedScale
tools.one_line_profile: Federated Learning benchmarking platform
tools.detailed_description: A scalable and extensible open-source platform for benchmarking and deploying federated learning (FL) algorithms and systems.

tools.name: AgentBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for evaluating LLMs as Agents
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark suite designed to evaluate Large Language Models (LLMs) acting as autonomous agents across various environments.

tools.name: tensorboard_logger
tools.one_line_profile: Library to log TensorBoard events without TensorFlow dependency
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that allows users to log metrics, images, and histograms to TensorBoard event files without needing to install the full TensorFlow framework. It is useful for lightweight experiment tracking in PyTorch or other non-TF environments.

tools.name: AI-Infra-Guard
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive AI Red Teaming and safety evaluation platform
tools.detailed_description: A platform developed by Tencent Zhuque Lab for AI Red Teaming, focusing on evaluating the safety, security, and robustness of AI models through adversarial testing and vulnerability scanning.

tools.name: GFPGAN
tools.one_line_profile: Practical algorithm for real-world face restoration
tools.detailed_description: A blind face restoration algorithm that leverages a Generative Facial Prior (GFP) to restore low-quality face images. It is widely used for image enhancement and preprocessing in computer vision research.

tools.name: LLMstudio
tools.one_line_profile: Framework and UI for LLM fine-tuning and prompt engineering
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to manage the lifecycle of Large Language Model (LLM) applications, offering tools for prompt engineering, fine-tuning, and evaluating models, bridging the gap between experimentation and production.

tools.name: Local-LLM-Comparison-Colab-UI
tools.one_line_profile: WebUI for benchmarking and comparing local LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A Colab-compatible WebUI tool designed to run and compare the performance and outputs of various Large Language Models (LLMs) on consumer hardware, facilitating model evaluation and selection.

tools.name: CPM-1-Generate
tools.one_line_profile: Inference code for Chinese Pre-Trained Language Models (CPM-LM)
tools.detailed_description: Provides the generation code and model interface for CPM-1, a large-scale Chinese pre-trained language model, enabling researchers to perform text generation and downstream NLP tasks.

tools.name: ModelDB
tools.one_line_profile: Open source system for ML model versioning and experiment management
tools.detailed_description: A system to manage machine learning models, including versioning models, tracking metadata, and managing experiments. It helps researchers ensure reproducibility and track the history of model development.

tools.name: VevestaX
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight library for tracking ML experiments and EDA
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to track machine learning experiments and exploratory data analysis (EDA) with minimal code changes, automatically logging features, parameters, and performance metrics.

tools.name: NeuroNLP2
tools.one_line_profile: Deep neural models library for core NLP tasks
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based library implementing deep neural network models for various core Natural Language Processing tasks, serving as a toolkit for NLP research and experimentation.

tools.name: Xwin-LM
tools.one_line_profile: Models and methods for LLM alignment and reproducibility
tools.detailed_description: Provides a suite of Large Language Models and alignment methodologies (like RLHF) focused on stability and reproducibility, serving as a resource for research into LLM alignment techniques.

tools.name: Geochemistrypi
tools.one_line_profile: Automated machine learning framework for geochemistry
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python framework designed for data-driven discovery in geochemistry. It automates the machine learning pipeline for analyzing geochemical data, supporting tasks like classification, regression, and clustering in geological contexts.

tools.name: ACTS
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for charged particle track reconstruction in high energy physics
tools.detailed_description: An experiment-independent toolkit for track reconstruction in high energy physics experiments. It provides modern, thread-safe implementations of tracking algorithms and geometry handling for particle physics research.

tools.name: OlliePy
tools.one_line_profile: Library for ML experiment evaluation and data exploration
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that assists data scientists in exploring data and evaluating machine learning experiments by generating web-based reports and dashboards for analysis.

tools.name: Aim
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source experiment tracker for machine learning metadata
tools.detailed_description: Aim is an easy-to-use and supercharged open-source experiment tracker that logs training runs, hyperparameters, and metrics, providing a UI for comparison and visualization of ML experiments.

tools.name: aimlflow
tools.one_line_profile: Integration tool to sync MLflow runs with Aim
tools.detailed_description: A synchronization tool that allows users to track and visualize MLflow experiments using the Aim UI, bridging the gap between the two experiment tracking ecosystems.

tools.name: Mandala
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment tracking framework with integrated persistence logic
tools.detailed_description: Mandala is a framework that integrates experiment tracking directly with Python's persistence logic, enabling automatic memoization and queryable storage of computational graph results for data science projects.

tools.name: MLflow Export Import
tools.one_line_profile: Tools to export and import MLflow experiments and models
tools.detailed_description: A utility set for copying MLflow objects (experiments, runs, registered models) from one MLflow tracking server to another, facilitating data migration and backup in research workflows.

tools.name: Grand
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable and interoperable Python graph library
tools.detailed_description: Grand allows using familiar Python graph APIs (like NetworkX) on scalable backends (SQL, graph databases), enabling analysis of large-scale scientific network data that exceeds memory limits.

tools.name: Tartarus
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking platform for inverse molecular design
tools.detailed_description: Tartarus is a benchmarking platform designed to evaluate generative models for molecular design, focusing on realistic and practical scenarios in chemistry and drug discovery.

tools.name: Labwatch
tools.one_line_profile: Hyperparameter optimization extension for Sacred
tools.detailed_description: Labwatch connects the Sacred experiment tracking tool with various hyperparameter optimization libraries, enabling automated search and logging of optimal parameters in ML experiments.

tools.name: Ogama
tools.one_line_profile: OpenGazeAndMouseAnalyzer for eye and mouse tracking data
tools.detailed_description: Ogama is a software application for recording and analyzing eye- and mouse-tracking data from experimental setups, providing features for fixation detection, heatmaps, and statistical analysis.

tools.name: SageMaker Entrypoint Utilities
tools.one_line_profile: Utilities for SageMaker training entrypoints
tools.detailed_description: A library providing logging handlers, progress bar management, and hyperparameter parsing utilities to simplify the creation of robust training entrypoint scripts for scientific ML workflows on SageMaker.

tools.name: Foundation Model Benchmarking Tool
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking tool for foundation models on AWS
tools.detailed_description: A tool to benchmark the performance (latency, throughput, cost) of foundation models across various instance types and serving stacks, facilitating model selection for research and production.

tools.name: ML Lineage Helper
tools.one_line_profile: Wrapper for SageMaker ML Lineage Tracking
tools.detailed_description: A helper library that extends SageMaker's lineage tracking capabilities to cover end-to-end ML lifecycles, including feature store groups and artifact queries, ensuring reproducibility and auditability.

tools.name: AWS SDK for pandas
tools.one_line_profile: Pandas integration for AWS data services
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python library (formerly AWS Wrangler) that extends Pandas to easily connect with AWS data services like Athena, Glue, and Redshift, facilitating data processing for scientific workflows.

tools.name: Graph Notebook
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter notebook extension for graph databases
tools.detailed_description: A library extending Jupyter notebooks to integrate with graph databases (Gremlin, SPARQL, openCypher), providing visualization and query capabilities for graph data analysis.

tools.name: SageMaker Experiments
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment tracking SDK for Amazon SageMaker
tools.detailed_description: A Python SDK for tracking, organizing, and comparing machine learning experiments, runs, and metrics within the Amazon SageMaker environment.

tools.name: MXBoard
tools.one_line_profile: Logging MXNet data for visualization in TensorBoard
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that provides APIs for logging MXNet data for visualization in TensorBoard, enabling monitoring of training metrics and model performance.

tools.name: Cloud Detection Model
tools.one_line_profile: Cloud Detection Model for Sentinel-2 Imagery
tools.detailed_description: A semantic segmentation model and tool for detecting clouds in Sentinel-2 satellite imagery, supporting earth observation data processing.

tools.name: ml_board
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning dashboard for hyperparameter and log visualization
tools.detailed_description: A machine learning dashboard that displays hyperparameter settings alongside visualizations and logs, designed to track the scientist's thoughts and experiment progress.

tools.name: calkit
tools.one_line_profile: Project management and reproducibility tool for research
tools.detailed_description: A tool for simplified version control, environment management, and single-button reproducible pipelines specifically designed for research projects.

tools.name: Neptune
tools.one_line_profile: Trajectory planning framework for multiple robots
tools.detailed_description: A trajectory planning framework for multiple robots, supporting scientific modeling and control theory applications in robotics.

tools.name: Anserini
tools.one_line_profile: Lucene toolkit for reproducible information retrieval research
tools.detailed_description: A Lucene-based toolkit built to support reproducible information retrieval research, providing standard indexing and retrieval capabilities for scientific evaluation.

tools.name: Pyserini
tools.one_line_profile: Python toolkit for reproducible information retrieval research
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit for reproducible information retrieval research that supports sparse and dense representations, serving as a Python interface to Anserini.

tools.name: Catalyst
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerated deep learning R&D framework
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch framework for accelerated deep learning research and development, focusing on reproducibility, rapid experimentation, and codebase reuse.

tools.name: chaiNNer
tools.one_line_profile: Node-based image processing GUI for chaining tasks
tools.detailed_description: A node-based image processing GUI aimed at making chaining image processing tasks easy and customizable, supporting AI upscaling and programmatic image manipulation workflows.

tools.name: jupyterlab_tensorboard
tools.one_line_profile: Tensorboard extension for JupyterLab
tools.detailed_description: A JupyterLab extension that facilitates the integration of TensorBoard, allowing for seamless visualization of machine learning experiments within the Jupyter environment.

tools.name: Sacredboard
tools.one_line_profile: Dashboard for Sacred experiment tracking
tools.detailed_description: A web-based dashboard for Sacred, enabling users to monitor, access, and analyze past machine learning experiments and their configurations.

tools.name: Beholder
tools.one_line_profile: TensorBoard plugin for visualizing arbitrary tensors
tools.detailed_description: A TensorBoard plugin that allows for the visualization of arbitrary tensors as video overlays during network training, aiding in model debugging and interpretation.

tools.name: ClearML
tools.one_line_profile: MLOps platform for experiment management and orchestration
tools.detailed_description: An integrated MLOps platform that provides experiment management, data management, pipeline orchestration, and model serving to streamline AI workflows.

tools.name: ClearML Agent
tools.one_line_profile: Orchestration agent for ClearML
tools.detailed_description: The agent component for ClearML that handles the execution, scheduling, and orchestration of machine learning experiments and pipelines.

tools.name: ClearML Server
tools.one_line_profile: Backend infrastructure for the ClearML MLOps and experiment tracking platform
tools.detailed_description: ClearML Server is the backend service for the ClearML platform, providing experiment tracking, model management, and orchestration capabilities. It serves as the central repository for logging metrics, artifacts, and execution details of machine learning experiments.

tools.name: benchmark_VAE
tools.one_line_profile: Unified PyTorch implementation and benchmarking framework for Variational Autoencoders
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for implementing and benchmarking various Variational Autoencoder (VAE) models. It provides a unified interface to reproduce results and compare performance across different VAE architectures on standard datasets.

tools.name: Codabench
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible and reproducible benchmarking platform for AI competitions and tasks
tools.detailed_description: Codabench is a framework for creating and hosting benchmarks and competitions. It allows researchers to define tasks, metrics, and datasets to evaluate algorithms in a reproducible manner, supporting the organization of scientific challenges.

tools.name: WA-Testing-Tool
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation and testing scripts for Watson Assistant models
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools to perform K-fold validation and blind testing on Watson Assistant workspaces. It generates precision curves and other metrics to evaluate the performance of NLU models.

tools.name: Opik
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation and monitoring platform for LLM applications
tools.detailed_description: Opik provides tools to debug, evaluate, and monitor Large Language Model (LLM) applications. It includes features for comprehensive tracing of agentic workflows, automated evaluations, and dashboards for tracking model performance.

tools.name: DeepEval
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive evaluation framework for Large Language Models
tools.detailed_description: DeepEval is an open-source framework for testing and evaluating LLMs. It offers a suite of metrics to assess RAG pipelines and agents, ensuring outputs meet quality standards through automated unit testing and benchmarking.

tools.name: sna-js
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript library for egocentric social network analysis metrics
tools.detailed_description: A library to visualize and calculate relevant metrics for egocentric social network analysis (SNA) using adjacency matrices. It supports the computation of network statistics useful in social science research.

tools.name: CK-Crowdtuning
tools.one_line_profile: Crowdsourcing extension for Collective Knowledge benchmarking workflows
tools.detailed_description: An extension for the Collective Knowledge (CK) framework that enables crowdsourcing of experiments, such as performance benchmarking and auto-tuning of machine learning models across diverse hardware platforms.

tools.name: The Omega Project
tools.one_line_profile: Constraint-based tools for compiler dependence analysis and transformation
tools.detailed_description: A collection of tools and libraries (Omega Library, Omega Calculator, Omega Test) for manipulating sets of affine constraints and performing dependence analysis. These tools are fundamental for research in compiler optimization and polyhedral models.

tools.name: gtsummary
tools.one_line_profile: R package for creating presentation-ready data summary and analytic tables
tools.detailed_description: An R package designed to create publication-ready analytical and summary tables. It automates the reporting of regression models, descriptive statistics, and other scientific data analysis results.

tools.name: Determined
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning training platform with integrated experiment tracking
tools.detailed_description: Determined is an open-source deep learning training platform that handles distributed training, hyperparameter tuning, experiment tracking, and resource management. It enables researchers to track and reproduce experiments efficiently.

tools.name: machine-learning-interactive-visualization
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive visualization tools for ML model evaluation metrics
tools.detailed_description: A collection of notebooks and tools for interactively visualizing machine learning evaluation metrics (like ROC curves, precision-recall, etc.) to aid in model analysis and understanding.

tools.name: NLG-Metricverse
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end library for evaluating Natural Language Generation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library for evaluating Natural Language Generation (NLG) models. It provides a unified interface to access a wide range of evaluation metrics, facilitating the comparison and benchmarking of NLG systems.

tools.name: PromptSite
tools.one_line_profile: Version control and tracking system for LLM prompts
tools.detailed_description: PromptSite is a lightweight package for managing, versioning, and tracking LLM prompts. It helps researchers experiment with and debug prompts by maintaining a history of changes and their effects.

tools.name: TensorBoard
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization toolkit for machine learning experimentation
tools.detailed_description: A suite of visualization tools to understand and debug machine learning models, enabling tracking of metrics like loss and accuracy, visualizing the model graph, and projecting embeddings.

tools.name: Open LLM Leaderboard Report
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization report generator for Open LLM Leaderboard
tools.detailed_description: A tool to generate weekly visualization reports of Open LLM model performance based on various metrics, aiding in the tracking and comparison of large language models.

tools.name: MET (Model Evaluation Tools)
tools.one_line_profile: Verification and validation tools for meteorological models
tools.detailed_description: A suite of tools for evaluating the performance of meteorological models, providing state-of-the-art verification methods and metrics.

tools.name: performance
tools.one_line_profile: Assessment of regression models performance
tools.detailed_description: An R package to compute various performance metrics for regression models, including R2, ICC, LOO, AIC, and BF, facilitating model quality assessment.

tools.name: mltraq
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment tracking and collaboration tool for ML
tools.detailed_description: A library to track and collaborate on Machine Learning and AI experiments, supporting logging of parameters, metrics, and artifacts.

tools.name: isaaclab_rl
tools.one_line_profile: RL training library for Isaac Lab robotics simulation
tools.detailed_description: A library for training robotic agents in Isaac Lab using PPO, featuring built-in hyperparameter optimisation and extensive logging capabilities.

tools.name: tf-faster-rcnn
tools.one_line_profile: TensorFlow implementation of Faster R-CNN
tools.detailed_description: A widely used implementation of Faster R-CNN for object detection in TensorFlow, serving as a baseline and tool for computer vision research.

tools.name: NdLinear
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch module for model compression
tools.detailed_description: A drop-in PyTorch module that shrinks models with no accuracy loss, supporting export to various frameworks like ONNX and TensorRT.

tools.name: PyGaze
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for eye tracking experiments
tools.detailed_description: An open-source, cross-platform toolbox for minimal-effort programming of eye tracking experiments, supporting various eye trackers.

tools.name: papermill-mlflow
tools.one_line_profile: Integration for Papermill and MLflow
tools.detailed_description: A tool to integrate Jupyter notebooks (via Papermill) with MLflow for data science experimentation and tracking.

tools.name: ieee118_power_flow_data
tools.one_line_profile: Data pipeline for IEEE-118 power flow cases
tools.detailed_description: A data pipeline to build power flow cases for the IEEE-118 power system, facilitating power systems research and simulation.

tools.name: maggot
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight experiment tracking library
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python library designed to help keep track of numerical experiments, managing configurations and results.

tools.name: hermit
tools.one_line_profile: Hermetic sandbox for reproducible execution
tools.detailed_description: A tool that launches Linux programs in a hermetically isolated sandbox to ensure deterministic and repeatable behavior, useful for reproducible research artifacts and debugging.

tools.name: EvalGIM
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation library for generative image models
tools.detailed_description: A library for reproducible automatic evaluations of text-to-image models, supporting user-defined metrics, datasets, and visualizations.

tools.name: PySlowFast
tools.one_line_profile: Video understanding codebase
tools.detailed_description: A codebase for reproducing state-of-the-art video models, providing implementations of SlowFast and other video classification algorithms.

tools.name: Meta Agents Research Environments
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for evaluating AI agents
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive platform designed to evaluate AI agents in dynamic, realistic scenarios, supporting evolving environments for agent adaptation research.

tools.name: param
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for recommendation and AI models
tools.detailed_description: A repository for development of micro-benchmarks and end-to-end networks for evaluation of training and inference platforms, specifically for recommendation systems.

tools.name: keras-ocr
tools.one_line_profile: Packaged CRAFT and CRNN for OCR
tools.detailed_description: A flexible and packaged version of the CRAFT text detector and Keras CRNN recognition model for optical character recognition tasks.

tools.name: video-transformers
tools.one_line_profile: Fine-tuning tool for video classification models
tools.detailed_description: A library to simplify the fine-tuning of HuggingFace video classification models, providing an easy-to-use interface for video tasks.

tools.name: yolov5-pip
tools.one_line_profile: Packaged version of YOLOv5
tools.detailed_description: A pip-installable package of the Ultralytics YOLOv5 object detection model, facilitating easy integration into Python workflows.

tools.name: FaceRank
tools.one_line_profile: Face ranking using CNN
tools.detailed_description: A tool that uses a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) based on TensorFlow/Keras to rank faces, providing a scoring mechanism.

tools.name: FFMetrics
tools.one_line_profile: Video quality metrics visualization
tools.detailed_description: A tool to visualize video quality metrics such as PSNR, SSIM, and VMAF calculated by FFmpeg, aiding in video compression analysis.

tools.name: FlagPerf
tools.one_line_profile: AI chip benchmarking platform
tools.detailed_description: An open-source software platform for benchmarking AI chips, providing a standardized way to evaluate hardware performance for AI workloads.

tools.name: GTO (Git Tag Ops)
tools.one_line_profile: Git-based registry for versioning machine learning models and artifacts
tools.detailed_description: A tool that turns a Git repository into an artifact or model registry using Git tags. It allows data scientists to register, version, and manage the lifecycle of models and datasets directly within their version control system.

tools.name: tbparse
tools.one_line_profile: Parser for loading TensorBoard event logs into Pandas DataFrames
tools.detailed_description: A library designed to parse TensorBoard event logs (tfevents) and convert them into Pandas DataFrames. This facilitates custom analysis, statistical processing, and publication-quality plotting of experiment metrics outside of the TensorBoard UI.

tools.name: jeelizPupillometry
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based real-time pupillometry library using computer vision
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library that uses WebGL and deep learning to perform real-time pupillometry (measurement of pupil size) via a webcam. It is used in cognitive science and psychology experiments to measure physiological responses.

tools.name: clip-image-sorter
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for semantic image sorting and filtering using CLIP
tools.detailed_description: A browser-based tool that utilizes OpenAI's CLIP model to sort and organize local image datasets based on text prompts. It serves as a data processing utility for curating and filtering image datasets for scientific or ML purposes.

tools.name: OpenJSCAD
tools.one_line_profile: Programmatic 3D modeling tool for parametric design
tools.detailed_description: A set of modular tools for creating parametric 2D and 3D designs using JavaScript code. It provides a reproducible method for generating 3D models, useful for designing scientific apparatus, hardware components, and physical visualizations.

tools.name: Kedro
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for reproducible data science pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A development workflow framework that applies software engineering best practices to data science code. It helps structure data pipelines to be reproducible, modular, and maintainable, facilitating experiment tracking and collaboration.

tools.name: Kedro-Viz
tools.one_line_profile: Visualizer for Kedro data science pipelines
tools.detailed_description: A visualization tool for Kedro pipelines that displays the data lineage and structure of data science experiments. It helps researchers understand complex workflows and track the flow of data transformations.

tools.name: Hera
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time metrics dashboard for Keras models
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed to train and evaluate Keras models while streaming metrics to a browser-based dashboard. It provides real-time visualization of experiment performance, aiding in the monitoring and debugging of deep learning training processes.

tools.name: KitOps
tools.one_line_profile: Packaging and versioning tool for AI/ML model artifacts
tools.detailed_description: A DevOps tool that packages AI/ML models, datasets, code, and configurations into OCI (Open Container Initiative) artifacts (ModelKits). It facilitates the versioning, sharing, and deployment of scientific models in a standardized format.

tools.name: Klever Model Registry
tools.one_line_profile: Cloud-native registry for ML model management
tools.detailed_description: A tool for managing the lifecycle of machine learning models, providing a registry to index, version, and store model metadata. It supports the tracking of model lineage and facilitates collaboration in ML research and production.

tools.name: Kubeflow Model Registry
tools.one_line_profile: Centralized model registry for the Kubeflow ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: A component of the Kubeflow project that provides a central interface for indexing and managing ML models, versions, and artifact metadata. It bridges the gap between experimentation and production by tracking model lineage.

tools.name: LabML
tools.one_line_profile: Mobile monitoring tool for deep learning training
tools.detailed_description: A library and platform that allows researchers to monitor deep learning model training metrics and hardware usage (GPU/CPU) remotely via mobile devices. It assists in tracking long-running experiments.

tools.name: LangEvals
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for benchmarking and evaluating LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A tool that aggregates various language model evaluators into a single interface. It provides standard metrics and guardrails to benchmark LLM models and pipelines, facilitating the scientific evaluation of NLP models.

tools.name: tensorboardX
tools.one_line_profile: TensorBoard logging adapter for PyTorch and other frameworks
tools.detailed_description: A library that allows researchers using PyTorch, Chainer, MXNet, and other frameworks to write events and metrics to TensorBoard files. It enables the visualization of training curves, embeddings, and other scientific experiment data.

tools.name: Layer SDK
tools.one_line_profile: Metadata store SDK for production ML pipelines
tools.detailed_description: The SDK for Layer, a metadata store designed to track machine learning experiments, models, and datasets. It enables reproducibility and collaboration by managing the metadata of scientific workflows.

tools.name: VALL-E (PyTorch)
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of VALL-E zero-shot text-to-speech model
tools.detailed_description: An open-source implementation of the VALL-E text-to-speech model, capable of zero-shot speech synthesis and voice cloning, serving as a solver for audio generation research.

tools.name: Minetorch
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight PyTorch wrapper for deep learning training loops
tools.detailed_description: A minimalist library designed to simplify the training process of deep learning models in PyTorch, providing abstractions for training loops and experiment management.

tools.name: simple_GRPO
tools.one_line_profile: Minimal implementation of GRPO algorithm for LLM reasoning
tools.detailed_description: A simplified implementation of the Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) algorithm, designed for reproducing reasoning capabilities in Large Language Models (LLMs) similar to DeepSeek-R1.

tools.name: jupyter_tensorboard
tools.one_line_profile: Jupyter Notebook extension for starting TensorBoard
tools.detailed_description: A tool that integrates TensorBoard directly into the Jupyter Notebook interface, facilitating the tracking and visualization of machine learning experiments within the interactive coding environment.

tools.name: gaze_tracker
tools.one_line_profile: Eye gaze tracking system using OpenCV
tools.detailed_description: A computer vision-based application that estimates eye gaze direction to control a mouse pointer, serving as a tool for human-computer interaction research and behavioral analysis.

tools.name: ema-pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: Exponential Moving Average (EMA) wrapper for PyTorch models
tools.detailed_description: A utility library for maintaining an Exponential Moving Average of model parameters during training, which is a common technique in deep learning to improve model generalization and stability.

tools.name: µBench
tools.one_line_profile: Microservice benchmark for cloud/edge computing platforms
tools.detailed_description: A benchmarking tool designed to evaluate the performance of cloud and edge computing platforms by running customizable dummy microservice applications on Kubernetes.

tools.name: marimo
tools.one_line_profile: Reactive Python notebook for reproducible research
tools.detailed_description: A next-generation reactive notebook for Python that ensures reproducibility by executing as a script, supporting SQL queries, and providing a modern AI-native editing environment for scientific experiments.

tools.name: Banks
tools.one_line_profile: Jinja-based LLM prompt engineering and management tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for managing and generating LLM prompts using a Jinja-based template language, supporting metadata management, versioning, and storage, facilitating systematic prompt engineering research.

tools.name: plf_nanotimer
tools.one_line_profile: Cross-platform C++ microsecond-precision timer for benchmarking
tools.detailed_description: A simple, low-overhead C++ timer class designed for microsecond-precision benchmarking across different platforms, useful for performance analysis in scientific computing.

tools.name: rl-bh-environment
tools.one_line_profile: Reinforcement learning environment for bullet hell games
tools.detailed_description: A custom reinforcement learning environment simulating a bullet hell game (Sacred Curry Shooter), providing an interface for training and testing RL agents in dynamic environments.

tools.name: SacredBrowser
tools.one_line_profile: GUI for browsing Sacred experiment results
tools.detailed_description: A graphical user interface for browsing, filtering, and analyzing machine learning experiment results stored in MongoDB by the Sacred experiment management framework.

tools.name: Windows Agent Arena
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable OS platform for benchmarking multi-modal AI agents
tools.detailed_description: A scalable operating system platform designed for testing and benchmarking multi-modal AI agents, providing a realistic environment for evaluating agent performance on Windows tasks.

tools.name: Coyote
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for testing concurrent C# code and reproducing bugs
tools.detailed_description: A library and tool designed for the systematic testing of concurrent C# code, enabling deterministic reproduction of concurrency bugs, widely used in systems research and verification.

tools.name: Project Malmo
tools.one_line_profile: AI experimentation platform built on Minecraft
tools.detailed_description: A platform for Artificial Intelligence experimentation and research built on top of Minecraft, providing a rich, complex environment for testing reinforcement learning and multi-agent systems.

tools.name: Qlib
tools.one_line_profile: AI-oriented quantitative investment platform
tools.detailed_description: An AI-oriented quantitative investment platform that covers the entire chain of quantitative research, including data processing, model training (RL/Supervised), and backtesting, empowering AI-driven financial modeling.

tools.name: Responsible AI Toolbox Tracker
tools.one_line_profile: JupyterLab extension for tracking Responsible AI mitigations
tools.detailed_description: A JupyterLab extension designed to track, manage, and compare Responsible AI experiments and mitigations, facilitating the evaluation of model fairness and safety.

tools.name: MedPerf
tools.one_line_profile: Open benchmarking platform for medical AI using Federated Evaluation
tools.detailed_description: MedPerf is an open benchmarking platform designed specifically for medical artificial intelligence. It enables the evaluation of AI models on diverse, real-world medical datasets without requiring data to leave the data owner's premises (Federated Evaluation), ensuring privacy and compliance while providing robust performance metrics.

tools.name: MLflow
tools.one_line_profile: Open source platform for the machine learning lifecycle
tools.detailed_description: MLflow is a comprehensive platform for managing the end-to-end machine learning lifecycle. It includes components for experiment tracking (logging parameters, metrics, and artifacts), model packaging, model registry, and deployment, widely used in scientific research for reproducibility and experiment management.

tools.name: EvalScope
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for efficient large model evaluation and benchmarking
tools.detailed_description: EvalScope is a streamlined framework designed for the evaluation and performance benchmarking of large models (LLMs, VLMs). It supports various datasets and metrics, enabling researchers to assess model capabilities in tasks relevant to scientific discovery and general AI performance.

tools.name: MOSES
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking platform for molecular generation models
tools.detailed_description: Molecular Sets (MOSES) is a benchmarking platform specifically designed for molecular generation models in drug discovery. It provides standard datasets and a suite of metrics to evaluate the diversity, validity, and chemical properties of generated molecules, facilitating fair comparison of generative models.

tools.name: Neptune Client
tools.one_line_profile: Client library for Neptune experiment tracking and model registry
tools.detailed_description: The Neptune Client is the Python interface for Neptune, a metadata store for MLOps. It allows researchers to log, organize, and compare machine learning experiments, including metrics, hyperparameters, and model artifacts, facilitating reproducibility in scientific computing.

tools.name: ONNX Registry
tools.one_line_profile: Intelligent Component Registry web service for ONNX models
tools.detailed_description: A web service designed to act as a registry for managing and retrieving Spiking Neural Networks (SNN), Deep Neural Networks (DNN), and ML models stored in the ONNX format. It supports the tracking and versioning of model components in neuromorphic and IoT research contexts.

tools.name: Cosmos-Predict2.5
tools.one_line_profile: World Foundation Models for video-based future state prediction and simulation
tools.detailed_description: Cosmos-Predict2.5 is a suite of World Foundation Models (WFMs) designed to simulate and predict future states of the world through video generation. It serves as a scientific simulation tool for physical world dynamics.

tools.name: Onepanel
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end computer vision platform for annotation, training, and workflow automation
tools.detailed_description: Onepanel is a unified platform for computer vision workflows, integrating data labeling, model training, hyperparameter tuning, and pipeline automation. It supports reproducible research by managing the entire lifecycle of CV models.

tools.name: GenAIStudio
tools.one_line_profile: Low-code platform for constructing and benchmarking GenAI applications
tools.detailed_description: GenAI Studio provides a visual interface and toolkit for building, evaluating, and benchmarking Generative AI applications. It facilitates the assessment of model performance and the creation of deployable AI packages.

tools.name: OpenCompass
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive evaluation platform for Large Language Models
tools.detailed_description: OpenCompass is a dedicated platform for evaluating Large Language Models (LLMs) across various dimensions. It supports a wide range of models and datasets, providing consistent benchmarks and metrics for model comparison and analysis.

tools.name: Amphion
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for audio, music, and speech generation research
tools.detailed_description: Amphion is a toolkit designed to support reproducible research in audio, music, and speech generation. It provides implementations of various generation models and tools for processing audio data, aiming to lower the barrier for entry in audio AI research.

tools.name: modelstore
tools.one_line_profile: Library for versioning and exporting machine learning models
tools.detailed_description: modelstore is a Python library that facilitates the versioning, export, and storage of machine learning models to various storage providers. It helps in tracking model artifacts and maintaining a registry of trained models.

tools.name: mlogger
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight logger for machine learning experiments
tools.detailed_description: mlogger is a simple and lightweight logging utility specifically designed for machine learning. It helps researchers track metrics and experiment progress without the overhead of heavy frameworks.

tools.name: Android HCI Extractor
tools.one_line_profile: Multimodal Human-Computer Interaction extractor for Android experiments
tools.detailed_description: A tool for extracting, monitoring, and tracking multimodal user interactions on Android devices. It is designed for use in scientific experiments to record user behavior data for HCI research and analysis.

tools.name: PathBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking platform for path planning algorithms
tools.detailed_description: PathBench is a platform for benchmarking both classic and learning-based path planning algorithms. It provides a standardized environment to evaluate and compare the performance of navigation algorithms in robotics and AI.

tools.name: Phoronix Test Suite
tools.one_line_profile: Automated testing and benchmarking software for computing systems
tools.detailed_description: The Phoronix Test Suite is a comprehensive testing and benchmarking platform. While widely used for hardware validation, it serves as a scientific tool for empirical computer science research to measure system performance and reproducibility.

tools.name: Clean-Offline-RLHF
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark suite for Offline Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback
tools.detailed_description: This repository implements the Uni-RLHF benchmark suite, providing a platform for evaluating offline Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF) algorithms. It supports reproducible research in alignment and reinforcement learning.

tools.name: Uni-RLHF-Platform
tools.one_line_profile: Universal platform and benchmark suite for Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF)
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive platform and benchmark suite designed for Reinforcement Learning with Diverse Human Feedback (RLHF). It supports the evaluation and development of RLHF algorithms, providing a standardized environment for research and comparison.

tools.name: ploomber-engine
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for testing, tracking, and debugging Jupyter notebooks
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed to enhance Jupyter notebooks for scientific workflows. It includes features for experiment tracking, debugging, profiling, and testing notebooks, facilitating reproducible research and development in interactive environments.

tools.name: sklearn-evaluation
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning model evaluation and experiment tracking library
tools.detailed_description: A library that simplifies machine learning model evaluation by providing tools for generating plots, tables, and HTML reports. It also includes features for experiment tracking and analysis within Jupyter notebooks, aiding in the comparison and selection of models.

tools.name: Polyaxon
tools.one_line_profile: MLOps platform for managing and orchestrating the machine learning lifecycle
tools.detailed_description: A platform for reproducible and scalable machine learning and deep learning. It provides tools for experiment tracking, hyperparameter tuning, and workflow orchestration, allowing researchers to manage the entire ML lifecycle.

tools.name: TraceML
tools.one_line_profile: Engine for ML/Data tracking, visualization, and drift detection
tools.detailed_description: A library and engine dedicated to tracking machine learning experiments, visualizing data and model performance, explaining models, and detecting drift. It serves as the tracking component of the Polyaxon ecosystem but can be used for logging and analysis.

tools.name: Promptify
tools.one_line_profile: Prompt engineering and versioning toolkit for LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for prompt engineering, versioning, and structuring outputs from Large Language Models (LLMs). It facilitates the management of prompts as scientific artifacts, enabling reproducible interactions with NLP models.

tools.name: EconML
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Learning and Intelligence for Causation and Economics
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that applies machine learning techniques to estimate heterogeneous treatment effects from observational data via causal inference. It implements orthogonal machine learning algorithms to measure causal effects, bridging econometrics and machine learning.

tools.name: pseudo-3d-pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of Pseudo-3D Residual Networks (P-3D)
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of Pseudo-3D Residual Networks (P-3D) for spatiotemporal feature learning in videos. It includes support for pretrained models, enabling reproduction of results and application to video analysis tasks.

tools.name: RagaAI-Catalyst
tools.one_line_profile: Agent AI observability, monitoring, and evaluation framework
tools.detailed_description: A Python SDK for observing, monitoring, and evaluating AI agents. It provides features for tracing agent execution, debugging multi-agent systems, and analyzing performance via a dashboard, supporting the evaluation phase of AI research.

tools.name: rl-experiments
tools.one_line_profile: Configuration and tracking for Reinforcement Learning experiments
tools.detailed_description: A repository dedicated to tracking and reproducing Reinforcement Learning (RL) experiments using Ray RLlib. It serves as a benchmark reference, containing configurations and scripts to reproduce state-of-the-art results.

tools.name: FuxiCTR
tools.one_line_profile: Configurable and reproducible library for CTR prediction
tools.detailed_description: A configurable, tunable, and reproducible library designed for Click-Through Rate (CTR) prediction tasks. It provides a standardized environment for benchmarking various CTR models and ensuring experimental reproducibility.

tools.name: garage
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for reproducible reinforcement learning research
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for developing and evaluating reinforcement learning algorithms with a focus on reproducibility. It provides a consistent interface for running experiments and benchmarking RL methods.

tools.name: drake
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline toolkit for reproducibility in R
tools.detailed_description: An R-focused pipeline toolkit designed for reproducibility and high-performance computing. It manages data analysis workflows, tracks dependencies, and ensures that results are up-to-date and reproducible.

tools.name: greadability
tools.one_line_profile: Graph layout readability metrics library
tools.detailed_description: A JavaScript library for calculating readability metrics for graph layouts. It provides quantitative measures to evaluate the quality of graph visualizations, supporting research in information visualization and graph theory.

tools.name: vetiver-r
tools.one_line_profile: MLOps tool for versioning, sharing, deploying, and monitoring models in R
tools.detailed_description: Vetiver provides fluent tooling to version, share, deploy, and monitor machine learning models. It is designed to handle the lifecycle of models, ensuring they can be reliably tracked and maintained in production or research environments.

tools.name: llm-data-annotation
tools.one_line_profile: Framework using LLMs for data annotation and iterative active learning
tools.detailed_description: A framework that leverages Large Language Models (like GPT-3.5) to perform data annotation and model enhancement. It combines human expertise with LLMs and employs Iterative Active Learning and CleanLab (Confident Learning) to improve dataset quality.

tools.name: DVCP-TE
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation model of the Tennessee Eastman chemical process for security research
tools.detailed_description: The Damn Vulnerable Chemical Process (DVCP) - Tennessee Eastman is a simulation environment designed for research into cyber-physical systems security. It provides a realistic model of a chemical process to generate data for attack detection and control system analysis.

tools.name: Semantic-Shapes
tools.one_line_profile: Semantic segmentation pipeline for custom image annotation
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed to facilitate custom image annotation for semantic segmentation tasks. It aids in the processing and preparation of image datasets for computer vision research.

tools.name: EyeLoop
tools.one_line_profile: Python-based eye-tracking system for dynamic closed-loop experiments
tools.detailed_description: EyeLoop is a specialized eye-tracking tool tailored for dynamic, closed-loop experiments in neuroscience and psychology. It runs on consumer-grade hardware and provides a platform for behavioral data acquisition.

tools.name: Snakemake
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow management system for reproducible data analysis
tools.detailed_description: Snakemake is a workflow management system that aims to reduce the complexity of creating facsimiles of data analysis steps. It is widely used in bioinformatics and data science to ensure reproducibility and scalability of scientific pipelines.

tools.name: SeBS
tools.one_line_profile: Serverless Benchmarking Suite for FaaS platforms
tools.detailed_description: SeBS (Serverless Benchmarking Suite) is a tool for the automatic performance analysis of Function-as-a-Service (FaaS) platforms. It allows researchers to benchmark and evaluate the performance of serverless computing environments.

tools.name: Whitebox
tools.one_line_profile: E2E ML monitoring platform with edge capabilities
tools.detailed_description: Whitebox is an open-source machine learning monitoring platform designed to track model performance and data drift, specifically supporting edge capabilities and Kubernetes integration.

tools.name: HELM
tools.one_line_profile: Holistic Evaluation of Language Models framework
tools.detailed_description: HELM (Holistic Evaluation of Language Models) is a framework for the transparent and reproducible evaluation of foundation models (LLMs). It provides a standardized suite of metrics and scenarios to benchmark model performance across various dimensions.

tools.name: Julia-LLM-Leaderboard
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking platform for LLM code generation in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A platform and toolkit for evaluating and comparing the ability of Large Language Models to generate syntactically correct Julia code. It includes structured tests and automated evaluation pipelines.

tools.name: tensorboardcolab
tools.one_line_profile: Utility to run TensorBoard within Google Colab
tools.detailed_description: A library designed to facilitate the use of TensorBoard, a standard visualization tool for machine learning experiments, directly within the Google Colab environment.

tools.name: envd
tools.one_line_profile: Reproducible development environment manager for AI/Data Science
tools.detailed_description: envd is a command-line tool that creates reproducible development environments for AI and data science. It abstracts away Dockerfile complexity to ensure consistent environments for research and development.

tools.name: TensorBoard
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization toolkit for TensorFlow experiment tracking
tools.detailed_description: A suite of visualization tools for inspecting and understanding TensorFlow runs and graphs. It enables tracking and visualizing metrics such as loss and accuracy, viewing the model graph, and analyzing embeddings.

tools.name: Iterate
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking and hyperparameter optimization tool for TerraTorch
tools.detailed_description: A tool designed for benchmarking and hyper-parameter optimization within the TerraTorch ecosystem. It integrates MLFlow for experiment logging, Optuna for optimization, and Ray for parallel execution.

tools.name: Testground
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for benchmarking and simulating distributed systems
tools.detailed_description: A platform for testing, benchmarking, and simulating distributed and p2p systems at scale. It allows researchers and developers to verify protocols and systems under various network conditions.

tools.name: Crayon
tools.one_line_profile: Language-agnostic interface for TensorBoard visualization
tools.detailed_description: A tool that provides a language-agnostic interface to TensorBoard, allowing users to log and visualize experiment data from any programming language.

tools.name: Torch-Fidelity
tools.one_line_profile: High-fidelity performance metrics for generative models
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch library for calculating high-fidelity performance metrics for generative models, such as Inception Score (IS) and Fréchet Inception Distance (FID), ensuring reproducible evaluation.

tools.name: DVC
tools.one_line_profile: Data Version Control for machine learning projects
tools.detailed_description: An open-source tool for data management and machine learning experiment tracking. It handles large files, data sets, and machine learning models, making projects reproducible and shareable.

tools.name: DVCLive
tools.one_line_profile: Library for logging ML metrics and tracking experiments
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for logging machine learning metrics, parameters, and model artifacts. It integrates with DVC to provide experiment tracking capabilities.

tools.name: TruLens
tools.one_line_profile: Evaluation and tracking for LLM experiments
tools.detailed_description: A tool for evaluating and tracking Large Language Model (LLM) experiments and AI agents. It provides feedback functions to assess the quality and performance of LLM applications.

tools.name: ATOM
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Tool for Optimized Modelling
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for fast exploration and experimentation of machine learning pipelines. It automates data cleaning, feature engineering, and model selection.

tools.name: Uncertainty Toolbox
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox for predictive uncertainty quantification and metrics
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolbox for predictive uncertainty quantification, calibration, metrics, and visualization. It helps researchers evaluate the reliability of machine learning model predictions.

tools.name: TVault
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight local registry for comparing PyTorch models
tools.detailed_description: A tool to quickly compare PyTorch models in a local, lightweight registry. It facilitates tracking model versions and performance metrics during development.

tools.name: vSwarm-u
tools.one_line_profile: Serverless benchmark suite integrated with gem5
tools.detailed_description: A framework that integrates the serverless benchmark suite vSwarm with gem5, enabling research into system and microarchitecture for serverless computing.

tools.name: OpenCorr
tools.one_line_profile: Digital Image and Volume Correlation Library
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library for Digital Image Correlation (DIC) and Digital Volume Correlation (DVC), used for measuring deformation and strain in materials science and engineering.

tools.name: Omniboard
tools.one_line_profile: Web-based dashboard for Sacred experiment tracking
tools.detailed_description: A web dashboard for visualizing experiments tracked with Sacred. It connects to the MongoDB database used by Sacred to display metrics, configuration, and artifacts.

tools.name: SD-Extension-System-Info
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking and system info for Stable Diffusion
tools.detailed_description: An extension for Stable Diffusion web UIs that provides system information and standardized benchmarking capabilities to evaluate generation performance.

tools.name: Deepkit ML
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time machine learning development and tracking suite
tools.detailed_description: A collaborative open-source machine learning development tool and training suite. It offers experiment execution, real-time tracking, debugging, and project management features.

tools.name: PytorchAutoDrive
tools.one_line_profile: Segmentation and lane detection models with benchmarking
tools.detailed_description: A repository providing implementations of various segmentation and lane detection models for autonomous driving. It includes tools for fast training, visualization, benchmarking, and deployment.

tools.name: pref_voting
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for simulating and analyzing preferential voting methods
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed to study and run elections using various preferential voting methods, including graded and cardinal voting systems, suitable for social choice theory research.

tools.name: HiddenLayer
tools.one_line_profile: Neural network graph visualization and training metrics library
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight library for visualizing neural network graphs and tracking training metrics for PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Keras models.

tools.name: Weights & Biases
tools.one_line_profile: Developer platform for experiment tracking and model management
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive MLOps platform for tracking experiments, visualizing results, managing model versions, and collaborating on machine learning projects.

tools.name: MuZero General
tools.one_line_profile: General implementation of the MuZero reinforcement learning algorithm
tools.detailed_description: A readable and modular implementation of the MuZero algorithm, serving as a research baseline and tool for reinforcement learning experiments.

tools.name: Test Tube
tools.one_line_profile: Library for experiment logging and hyperparameter search
tools.detailed_description: A Python library designed to easily log deep learning experiments and parallelize hyperparameter search across computing clusters.

tools.name: pytorch-fcn
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of Fully Convolutional Networks
tools.detailed_description: A reproducible implementation of Fully Convolutional Networks (FCN) for semantic segmentation, serving as a baseline tool for computer vision research.

tools.name: tensorflow-plot
tools.one_line_profile: Utility for using Matplotlib within TensorFlow computation graphs
tools.detailed_description: A library that allows wrapping Matplotlib plots as TensorFlow operations, enabling visualization of training progress directly within TensorBoard.

tools.name: MultiKernelBench
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-platform benchmark for kernel generation
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite designed to evaluate the performance of kernel generation across multiple hardware platforms, aiding in system performance analysis.

tools.name: Real-ESRGAN
tools.one_line_profile: Practical algorithms for general image and video restoration
tools.detailed_description: A tool implementing Real-ESRGAN for enhancing and restoring images and videos, widely used for data preprocessing and quality improvement in vision tasks.

tools.name: MME
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for logging, replaying, and benchmarking LLM calls
tools.detailed_description: A plug-and-play platform designed to log, replay, and benchmark Large Language Model (LLM) API calls, facilitating evaluation and optimization of LLM applications.

tools.name: Arrakis
tools.one_line_profile: Library for mechanistic interpretability experiments
tools.detailed_description: A library designed to conduct, track, and visualize mechanistic interpretability experiments for neural networks, aiding in understanding model behavior.

tools.name: nerf-pytorch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF)
tools.detailed_description: A widely used PyTorch implementation of NeRF for synthesizing novel views of complex scenes, serving as a standard tool for 3D vision research.

tools.name: torchdistill
tools.one_line_profile: Reproducible deep learning framework for knowledge distillation
tools.detailed_description: A coding-free framework built on PyTorch designed for reproducible knowledge distillation studies, offering implementations of various distillation methods and benchmarking tools.

tools.name: friendly-stable-audio-tools
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for training and using stable audio generative models
tools.detailed_description: A refactored and updated library for working with audio/music generative models, facilitating research and application of stable audio generation.

tools.name: TF2DeepFloorplan
tools.one_line_profile: Deep FloorPlan Recognition tool with multi-task network
tools.detailed_description: A TensorFlow 2 implementation for floorplan recognition using a multi-task network, including deployment and visualization tools like TensorBoard and TFLite support.

tools.name: ZnTrack
tools.one_line_profile: Interface to create, run, and benchmark DVC pipelines in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python interface for DVC (Data Version Control) that allows creating, visualizing, and benchmarking data science pipelines directly from Python or Jupyter notebooks.

tools.name: pytorch-generative-model-collections
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of generative model implementations in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library containing implementations of various generative models (GANs, VAEs, etc.) in PyTorch, serving as a reference and toolbox for generative modeling research.

tools.name: SkySense-O
tools.one_line_profile: Open-world remote sensing interpretation model
tools.detailed_description: A vision-centric visual-language model aggregated with CLIP and SAM, designed for open-world remote sensing interpretation tasks.
